title: Session-trial-template template schema
description: Session-trial-template template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.session-element: A non-intermittent period in which the subject is in the experiment room. Note that in an ephys context a session often corresponds to a day of recording, but in certain cases, several sessions can occur during a single day - the session id must be chosen to gaurantee its uniqueness.
propertyDescriptions.trial-element: A trial is defined as a single performance of a given task or a single presentation of a stimulus.
propertyDescriptions.in2pb-header: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.
propertyDescriptions.free-text-field: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.
propertyDescriptions.session-trial-header: Header with instructions for the sessions and trial metadata.

items.title: session-element field schema
items.description: session-element field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.sessionID: A session is defined as the continuous time block between when the first data point is recorded after the subject is brought in and when the subject leaves. The sessionID is a unique identifier which should match the “ses-<label>” used in file naming system.
propertyDescriptions.sessionStartDateTime: Date and time of start of session. This should correspond to the first date time when the first data point of the session was recorded.
propertyDescriptions.sessionDuration: The total duration of the session.
propertyDescriptions.sessionQuality: A general rating of the quality of the session to simplify data screenings for further analyses.
propertyDescriptions.sessionDataQuality: A general rating of the quality of the primary data signals.
propertyDescriptions.trialCount: Total number of trials within a session.
propertyDescriptions.trialDefinition: A free text space to provide the unambiguous description of what does a trial correspond to in the described session.

propertyDescriptions.in2pb-header: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

in2pb-header.title: in2pb-header field schema
in2pb-header.description: in2pb-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
In2PrimateBrains Metadata Template

The template here aims to allow the researchers to contribute structured metadata describing their experiments intuitively using a form-based and spreadsheet like interface. This in turns enhances the findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability (FAIR) of your contributed datasets.

This metadata template was developed based on existing data standards and minimum reporting guidelines by the research team at the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München (LMU) and the German Neuroinformatics Node. The template was built as a part of the In2PrimateBrains Project, funded by MSCA-ITN-H2020 Grant Number 956669.

The template was built with the Center for Expanded Data Annotation and Retrieval (CEDAR) Workbench.

If you need any clarification about this form or if you're interested in contributing, please reach out to Reema Gupta (reema.gupta@lmu.de).

Tips for using this form:

  1. To see the description of the field, hover the cursor on
  2. There may be too many items in the drop-down menu for fields assigned with ontological support. Please enter the first few letters of your desired value and wait for a few seconds. The form will attempt to autocomplete your entry with standardized vocabulary.
  3. In the top-right corner, you can use the “Copy” button  to duplicate the field or element, or the “Toggle View” button  to switch to a tabular spreadsheet-like view for metadata entry. This applies to fields or elements that allow multiple entries.
  4. If the information is not available or is not applicable, leave the field blank.
  5. Use the free text field at the end of the template to provide any other additional information that you may want to convey.

session-trial-header.title: session-trial-header field schema
session-trial-header.description: session-trial-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
Session Trial Metadata Template

The purpose of this template is to provide the metadata for about the sessions and trials.

This template is further divided into 2 different sections:

  1. Session Metadata: This section provides metadata about the sessions recorded.
  2. Trial Metadata: This section provides metadata about trials corresponding to the sessions described above.
